pynrand
  • 1. Installation instructions

1. Installation instructions¶

1.1. Install pynrand¶

First, open up the appropriate command line interface. On Unix-based systems, you would open a terminal. On Windows systems you would open an Anaconda Prompt as an administrator.

Next, assuming that you have downloaded/cloned the pynrand git repository, change into the root of said repository, and run the following command:

pip install .

Note that you must include the period as well. The above command executes a standard installation of pynrand. Upon completing the standard installation of pynrand, a set of libraries should be installed including numpy, and pytest.

Optionally, for additional features in pynrand, one can install additional dependencies upon installing pynrand. To install a subset of additional dependencies, run the following command from the root of the repository:

pip install .[<selector>]

where <selector> can be one of the following:

  • doc: to install the dependencies necessary for documentation generation;

  • examples: to install the dependencies necessary for running any example scripts;

  • all: to install all additional dependencies.

1.2. Update pynrand¶

If you, or someone else has made changes to this library, you can reinstall it by issuing the following command from the root of the repository:

pip install .

or the command:

pip install .[<selector>]

where <selector> was described in the previous section.

1.3. Uninstall pynrand¶

To uninstall pynrand, run the following command from the root of the repository:

pip uninstall pynrand

1.4. Exploring examples of using pynrand¶

Examples of using pynrand can be found in the directory <root>/examples, where <root> is the root of the repository. The dependencies required for running these example can be installed by running the following command from the root of the repository:

pip install .[examples]

or the command:

pip install .[all]

Note that the latter command will install all extra dependencies of pynrand.

1.5. Generating documention files¶

To generate documentation in html format from source files, you will also need to install several other packages. This can be done by running the following command from the root of the repository:

pip install .[doc]

or the command:

pip install .[all]

Note that the latter command will install all extra dependencies of pynrand.

Next, assuming that you are in the root of the repository, that you have installed all the prerequisite packages, and that pynrand has been installed, you can generate the pynrand documentation html files by issuing the following commands within your virtual environment:

cd docs
make html

This will generate a set of html files in ./_build/html containing the documentation of pynrand. You can then open any of the files using your favorite web browser.

If pynrand has been updated, the documentation has most likely changed as well. To update the documentation simply run:

make html

again to generate the new documentation.
